body: Thanks for your report. What is the folder root path? Are there any symlinks/junctions involved?
No symlinks/junctions or other ntfs weirdness.  Root path for the problematic folder is `d:\minecraft\curse`

issue.title: lib/fs: Fix watcher panic due to casing on windows (fixes #4877)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
### Purpose

`filepath.EvalSymlinks` nicely converts the drive letter to uppercase, while `filepath.Clean` does not. Hence if a lowercase letter was used as folder path, the watcher would panic. Now I make sure that all absolute paths in the watcher code are symlink-evaluated.

### Testing

Added reproducer for #4877 

If anyone wants to merge, the second last commit message is the right one...

body:
Could you run the following build: https://build.syncthing.net/repository/download/Syncthing_BuildWindows/19250:id/syncthing-windows-amd64-v0.14.47-rc.1%2B4-g8b5421a.zip
It is equivalent to v0.14.47-rc1 except for adding some info to the panic message (see #4878).

Can't get it stuck in a loop again but if I twiddle the fswatcher off/on on the folder it panics:

```
[XPQFK] 12:51:49 INFO: Device FCRHBDP-IKIU4AL-A6K3ZNS-UCF34Y4-5WZ47SD-MMLZKX7-DAOJMNB-JZJS2AS client is "syncthing v0.14.46" named "Shelbys-MBP" at 192.168.13.11:22000-32.97.110.51:64930/tcp-server
Panic at 2018-04-12T12:52:24-05:00
panic: bug: Notify backend is processing a change outside of the filesystem root: root==\\?\d:\minecraft\curse, rootSymEval==\\?\D:\Minecraft\curse, path==\\?\d:\minecraft\curse\.syncthing.tmp.973959822
```

Edit:  Probably would have been looping if there were incoming changes to that folder but since I had previously disabled fswatcher everything was synced up?

Case difference...

Side note: Which is interesting. Is EvalSymlinks a way to get the real casing...?
Yeah, this is one of the very first machines I installed syncthing on and the folder path recorded in the config definitely does not match the NTFS filename case.
Same problem here. Disabling fswatcher seems to calm it down.

issue.title: panic: bug: Notify backend is processing a change outside of the filesystem root

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body: As reported on 0.14.50 in the forum thread https://forum.syncthing.net/t/panic-bug-notify-backend-is-processing-a-change-outside-of-the-filesystem-root/12133, previously presumed fixed in #4877
